Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL ?; PAINTED
Name: Nubian vase of red earthenware
Description: The clay vase comes from the excavations of F. Griffith at Faras in 1910. The upper part of the large  belly is decorated by three rows of circles crossed perpendicularly  by three spherical lines. The inside pattern is filled alternatively with leaves and with diamonds showing motifs of small lozenges. The receptacle, which is distinguished by a very straight cylindrical neck, dates from the Meroitic Period.
